stories.text:
Every now and then, someone in my social circle wonders how they have been talking about some product or service with someone, only to see an ad for it a bit later in their social media feed.

Then they wonder how this happened. Paranoia kicks in like "this phone is listening to us" or "they can read our encrypted chat messages".

I've tried to find ways to explain this topic in simple, layman's terms, but mostly failed by going too much into details and confused them even more.

What's equally important is that I'd like to give them actionable tips so they can protect themselves and their friends & family.

What's your go-to explanation on this topic, and the best (simple) actionable advice on how they can protect themselves?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to explain common people what online tracking is?

stories.text:
I've purchased a new construction and have some choices in allowances but limited timeline. This is my first purchase and I'm not a networking expert by any stretch. I've asked for them to add flexible 1" conduit from attic to each room, for future fishlineing, and they've upgraded from CAT5 to CAT7 at my request. This is the boundary of knowledge. -- I want to make sure there's future proofed ability to upgrade in the event a local ISP gets fiber to the home, or otherwise better than copper.

Where should I go to learn more? Any basic tips or best practices? They will be foam spraying in a few days so I'm on a bit of a deadline to brush up, not concerned with budget or all the bells and whistles as I am making future upgrades easier or possible.

Thanks !
stories.title: Ask HN: How to instruct builders for future proofing networking in new house?

stories.text: What was your experience? does documenting business process with tools like BPMN improve effectiveness etc.
